text: Draught at the brewery. Clear reddish. Aroma medium malty (caramel, roasted) and hoppy. Flavor medium sweet and bitter. Medium body.
Form the tap at the brewpub. Dark hazlenut colored with off white head. Aroma of rosted malts and nuts. Some Brown shugar and liqurice. Taste is roast and hazlenut. Some decenthops in the finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Malty-dark beginning. Intense roasted, nice hopped, fresh. Malty smooth. Caramel, nice smooth malt. Dark, sweetish but not sticky. The bitterness helps to create a good balance. Intense malty on the tongue with a great bitter-sweet balance. Nice.

At the brewpub, pours a deep copper color with a thick white head. The smell is, bread, toasted malt, brown sugar. The taste is toasted malt, bread, hint of caramel ending dry. The body is light+ with pleasant fine carbonation. Nice...
Draught @ Brewpub. Pours amber with a creamy white head. Caramel, fruit and bread. Chewy and clean. Really nice.

Eigener Antrunk, dominiert von einem dumpfen Hopfenton. Im Mittelteil grasiger, der Hopfen wird aromatischer und bleibt dies auch. Vollmundig aber eher unsüffig scheint das Bier hier zu sein, hintergründig mit einer Vielzahl von Aromen. Auch das Malz befindet sich hier noch im Hintergrund und kommt erst im Abgang zur Geltung. Immerhin setzt es hier direkt intensiv ein, hat aber gegen die Hopfigkeit keine Chance und muss sich mit Platz 2 zufireden geben. Untypisches und voluminös hopfiges Dunkel. 	 
Test vom 14.8.2008, Gebinde: Fass 	Noten: 11,13,12,12,-,12 - 12,05

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2014 First rating2 liter bügel bottle from a getrankemarkt in Hanover. Sampled on December 28, 2010.Filled 27.10.10.Clear dark brown color, fluffy lasting tan head. Sweet, malty, roasted scent. Sweet, malty, herbal taste. Sweet finish. Smooth mouthfeel, medium herbal bitterness.7/4/8/4/15=3.8RerateAt the Hannoversches Bierfest, draught, on June 7, 2014.Clear brown color, teal head. Sweet, malty scent. Malty, light roasted taste. Grainy aftertaste. Fizzy mouthfeel, medium bitterness.7/4/7/3/13=3.4

Clear dark amber with a large beige head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt, caramel, grassy hops and hints of bread. Fairly dry flavour with caramel, grassy hops and roasted malt. Finished dry and bitter.

Draught at the brewpub. The color is beautiful, clear red-brown with a nice head. The aroma has notes of butterscotch and caramel. The flavour has a light sweetness and lots of nice butterscotch, light syrup and dry citrus. It is smooth and pleasant and yet refreshing with a citrus-bite in the finish.

Draught @ Rupp-Bräu Brewery tap, Felsenkeller, Feggendorfer Str. 10 31867 Lauenau, Niedersachsen, Germany.Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy - creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, roasted, caramel, nutty, toffee, light hoppy, orange. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20081211][ Good BEER Guide Germany #743 ]
Bottled at the brewery. Courtesy of Wintercoat. Clear amber colour with a huge beige head. Sweet malty aroma and taste with notes of caramel , nuts and fruits.Nice beer.

Bottle. Heavy malty, cookie, caramel. Large creamy light brown head, red-brown clear body. Moderate sweet, average duration. Light to medium body, dry & oily/creamy, soft carbonation. Later on it gets maybe a little bit too sweet.
A good Dunkel.
Draught at the Felsenkeller Brauerei Gastätte, Lauenau. Amber color. Malty, toasty and toffeish aroma. Malty, caramelly and toasty flavor with bitter finish.

Draft. A nut brown beer with a lazing off-white head. The aroma is sweet with primary notes of caramel, but also light notes of alcohol and metal. The flavor is sweet malty again with primary notes of caramel, and lighter notes of alcohol and metal, leading to a dry bitter end with a light metal note lingering around.

(On tap) Clear, orangey brown with an off-white head leaving laces. Nice aroma of roasted malt. Medium body with distinct notes of roasted malt and a - for a Dunkel - surprising bitterness in the finish. 051106
Draught. Reddish brown coloured. Surprisingly hoppy aroma. Very well balanced malty flavour with lots of hops. Hop bitter finish. A wonderful Dunkel.
Draught. Malty, hoppy aroma. Dark chestnut colour. Plenty, stable, creamy head. Aromatic, hoppy flavour with buttery aftertaste.
Tap at the bräuhaus. Brown colour with a big off-white head. Light sweet roasted malty aroma and a sweet fruity malty light bitter hoppy taste.  Medium to full body and a  sweet bitter finish.
A bit disappointing, a small brewery in the heart of Germany, with excellent German kitchen, I must say that I have been served better beers in an ordinary German bar.This was just average.
A really nice dunkel. Quite malty and roasted. Hoppy and fruity. Very full-bodied.

Light roasted aroma. Light brown color, white head, good lace. Little flavor off nuts, light wood, light bitter, light sweet. Long lasting hopbitter finish. Not a bad example of the Dunkel but the flavors should have been stronger.
